attributes.action: increase the time a 'warning' against a caveat needs responding to from 8 days to 30 days to allow for holidays and seeking legal advice.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Anyone can ask for a caveat to be entered to stop a suspect document continuing through Probate as a valid Will. The person applying for Probate may issue a "warning" against it.
Unscrupulous people and solicitors can wait for the caveator to go on holiday then enter a warning to the caveat. After 8 days the caveat is removed as no response is received.
The caveator might also wish to seek legal advice that may take longer than 8 days,  especially as the rules surrounding caveats and warnings are not well known. As people frequently go on holiday for 2 or 3 weeks it is sensible to make the period longer so they have a chance to maybe return from holiday and/or seek legal advice.
